plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular autumn-blooming perennials known for their diverse flower forms and vibrant colors. They are widely cultivated in gardens and used as cut flowers.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, widely cultivated in East Asia, Europe, and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are symbols of autumn in Japan and are celebrated during the annual Festival of Happiness.

plants.name: Bougainvillea glabra
plants.description: A tropical vine prized for its brilliant, papery bracts which surround the small white flowers. It thrives in subtropical and tropical climates, blooming year-round with peaks.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round with peaks in spring and fall
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions including South America, Southern USA, Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: Bougainvillea bracts are often mistaken for petals; true flowers are small and white.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree known for its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects.
plants.funFact: Banksias are important food sources for honeyeaters and are adapted to survive frequent Australian bushfires.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with glossy leaves and beautiful, rose-like flowers that bloom in late autumn to winter.
plants.location: East Asia (native), widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica was the first camellia species introduced to Europe and is prized for its ornamental value.
